Description: Rectangular multinozzler pottery lamp. Splayed stub-handle at rear. Sunken top; raised edge to filling-hole. Five rounded wick-holes along front edge. Raised rectangular base. Brown, micaceous clay.
Curator's comments: Close: Hayes, J.W., 1980. ‘Ancient lamps in the Royal Ontario Museum’. Toronto : Royal Ontario Museum, 188 = Petrie, W.M.F., 1905. ‘Roman Ehnasya (Herakleopolis Magna) 1904’. London : Egypt Exploration Fund, pl. LVII, M 62.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (1972)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
